’s design goals and motivation are to provide a library for running non-blocking asynchronous SSH commands in parallel with little to no load induced on the system by doing so with the intended usage being completely programmatic and non-interactive.

trans-unit.source: A configuration management and automation tool that makes use of SSH remote commands. Uses, in parts, both Paramiko and OpenSSH binaries.
trans-unit.target: Инструмент управления конфигурацией и автоматизации,использующий удаленные команды SSH.Использует по частям как исполняемые файлы Paramiko,так и OpenSSH.

trans-unit.source: After

Again similar to Fabric, its intended and documented use is interactive via command line rather than library API based. It may, however, be an option if Ansible is already being used for automation purposes with existing playbooks, the number of hosts is small, and when the use case is interactive via command line.
trans-unit.target: Опять же,как и Fabric,его предполагаемое и документированное использование интерактивно через командную строку,а не через библиотечный API.Однако это может быть вариантом,если Ansible уже используется в целях автоматизации с существующими книгами воспроизведения,количество хостов невелико,и если сценарий использования интерактивен через командную строку.

trans-unit.source: Ansible
As always, it is best to use a tool that is suited to the task at hand.
trans-unit.target: Как всегда,лучше всего использовать инструмент,соответствующий поставленной задаче.

Asynchronous parallel SSH library

C library. Used by
Comparison With Alternatives
Contents

Conversely, many short lived commands with output gathering will not scale as well. In this use case, smaller pool sizes in the hundreds are likely to perform better with regards to CPU overhead in the event loop.
trans-unit.target: И наоборот,многие кратковременные команды со сбором выходных данных также не будут масштабироваться.В этом случае использование меньшего размера пула в сотнях,скорее всего,будет лучше работать в отношении накладных расходов процессора в цикле обработки событий.

trans-unit.source: EPL
Exit codes
Fabric

Gathering is highlighted here as output generation does not affect scaling. Only when output is gathered either over multiple still running commands, or while more commands are being triggered, is overhead increased.
trans-unit.target: Сбор выделяется здесь,так как генерация выходных данных не влияет на масштабирование.Только когда выходные данные собираются либо по нескольким еще выполняющимся командам,либо при срабатывании большего количества команд,увеличиваются накладные расходы.

trans-unit.source: Highest performance and least overhead of any Python SSH library
trans-unit.target: Самая высокая производительность и наименьшее количество накладных расходов среди всех библиотек Python SSH.

trans-unit.source: HostOutput.exit_code
However, it lacks support for some SSH features present elsewhere like ECDSA keys (PR pending), agent forwarding (PR also pending) and Kerberos authentication - see feature comparison.
trans-unit.target: However, it lacks support for some SSH features present elsewhere like ECDSA keys (PR pending), agent forwarding (PR also pending) and Kerberos authentication - see feature comparison.

trans-unit.source: In addition,

In general, long lived commands with little or no output gathering will scale better. Pool sizes in the multiple thousands have been used successfully with little CPU overhead in the single thread running them in these use cases.
trans-unit.target: In general, long lived commands with little or no output gathering will scale better. Pool sizes in the multiple thousands have been used successfully with little CPU overhead in the single thread running them in these use cases.

trans-unit.source: Installation

It does not support non-blocking mode, so to make it non-blocking monkey patching must be used which affects all other uses of the Python standard library. However, some functionality like Kerberos (GSS-API) authentication is not currently provided by other libraries.

Note that enabling recursion with SCP requires server SFTP support for creating remote directories.

trans-unit.source: On the other end of the spectrum, long lived remote commands that generate no output only need the event loop at the start, when they are establishing connections, and at the end, when they are finished and need to gather exit codes, which results in practically zero CPU overhead at any time other than start or end of command execution.
trans-unit.target: On the other end of the spectrum, long lived remote commands that generate no output only need the event loop at the start, when they are establishing connections, and at the end, when they are finished and need to gather exit codes, which results in practically zero CPU overhead at any time other than start or end of command execution.

trans-unit.target: Из всех доступных библиотек Python SSH,

trans-unit.source: Python 3 only
Run
Run SSH commands over many - hundreds/hundreds of thousands - number of servers asynchronously and with minimal system load on the client host.
trans-unit.target: Выполняйте SSH команды над многими-сотнями/сотнями тысяч-количеством серверов асинхронно и с минимальной системной нагрузкой на клиентский хост.

trans-unit.source: SCP
SCP is supported - native clients only - and provides the best performance for file copying.
trans-unit.target: SCP поддерживается-только для родных клиентов-и обеспечивает наилучшую производительность при копировании файлов.

trans-unit.source: SFTP

SFTP is supported natively. Performance is much slower than SCP due to underlying library limitations and SCP should be preferred where possible. In the case of the deprecated paramiko clients, several bugs exist with SFTP performance and behaviour - avoid if at all possible.
trans-unit.target: SFTP поддерживается нативно.Производительность намного медленнее,чем SCP,из-за лежащих в основе библиотечных ограничений,и SCP следует предпочитать там,где это возможно.В случае устаревших клиентов-параметристов,существует несколько ошибок с производительностью и поведением SFTP-избегайте их,если это возможно.

trans-unit.source: ssh2-python
stdout

the event loop to allow others to execute - co-operation. When one co-routine is constantly grabbing the event loop in order to gather output, or when co-routines are constantly trying to start new short-lived commands, it causes contention with other co-routines that also want to use the event loop.
trans-unit.target: the event loop to allow others to execute - co-operation. When one co-routine is constantly grabbing the event loop in order to gather output, or when co-routines are constantly trying to start new short-lived commands, it causes contention with other co-routines that also want to use the event loop.
